definition: a wise man has passed away (idiom)

sentences.english: I have ever heard of a story told by a philosopher.
sentences.chinese: 曾聽過一位哲人講的故事。

sentences.english: Hindus are taught that “truth is one, the sages give it various names.”
sentences.chinese: 印度教訓示“真理唯一，哲人以不同名字稱謂之。”

sentences.english: Experience keeps a dear school! while fools learn in no other.
sentences.chinese: 經歷學校學費高，哲人旁處學不到。

sentences.english: Experience keeps a dear school:simply fools learn in no other.
sentences.chinese: 體驗學校學費高，哲人旁處學不到。

sentences.english: Thus we have heard from the wise who taught us this.
sentences.chinese: 如是我聞自所受教之哲人。

sentences.english: Experience keeps a dear school-but yet fools learn in no other.
sentences.chinese: 體驗學校學費高，哲人旁處學不到。

sentences.english: Leninist leaders, in other words, are only temporary Philosopher-Kings.
sentences.chinese: 也就是說，列寧主張的領導者們僅僅是暫時的哲人王。

sentences.english: The face of disaster stricken old man, in the eyes of philosophers is beautiful.
sentences.chinese: 面對飽經災難的老者，在哲人的眼裏是美的。

sentences.english: The pre-philosophers, philosophers who proceeded Socrates.
sentences.chinese: 比如先哲蘇格拉底，就是一位前瞻型的哲人。

sentences.english: Actually an idea Aristotle had got from the pre-Socratic philosophers.
sentences.chinese: 事實上這個想法來自先於蘇格拉底時期的哲人。

definition: Socrates (469-399 BC), Greek philosopher/José Sócrates (1957-), prime minister of Portugal (2005-2011)
Baruch or Benedict Spinoza (1632-1677), rationalist philosopher
Georg Wilhelm Friedrich Hegel (1770-1831), German philosopher
a sage/wise and holy man/virtuous ruler/Buddhist lama/wine
